alert.note: Alert for Madison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Madison County through 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winston, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Madison County, including the following locations... Bybee, College Hill, Moberly, Terrill, Brassfield, Reeds Crossing, Speedwell and Elliston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
